alert.note: Alert for Summit (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 10:53AM EST until February 19 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Cuyahoga River At Independence affecting Cuyahoga County. Cuyahoga River At Old Portage affecting Summit County. Mahoning River At Warren affecting Trumbull County. Mahoning River At Leavittsburg affecting Trumbull County. Mahoning River At Youngstown affecting Mahoning and Trumbull Counties. Eagle Creek At Phalanx Station affecting Trumbull County. Killbuck Creek Near Killbuck affecting Holmes and Wayne Counties. For the Cuyahoga River...including Old Portage, Independence...Major flooding is forecast. For the Killbuck Creek...including Killbuck...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Mahoning River...including Leavittsburg, Warren, Youngstown...Major flooding is forecast. For the Site Specific Non-forecast Pt...including Phalanx Station... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cuyahoga River At Old Portage. * WHEN...From late tonight to Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Floodwaters will begin to affect areas along the Cuyahoga River in Cuyahoga Falls and in Munroe Falls near Kennedy Park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EST Thursday the stage was 6.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 11.3 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.1 feet on 09/07/1990. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening by 900 PM EST.
